title: Calories in a McDouble
meta_description: Discover calories in a McDouble from McDonald's, including full nutrition breakdown like protein, fat, carbs, sodium, and easy tweaks for custom orders.
assumptions: Standard McDonald's McDouble: two 100% beef patties, one slice American cheese, onions, pickles, ketchup, mustard, on a regular bun; no modifications or extras.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, preparation, and customizations; values based on official McDonald's data. Check app or menu for latest.

quick_answer.text: A standard McDouble provides about 390 calories and 23 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a McDouble?
What's the protein in a McDouble?
faqs.a: About 23 g of protein from the beef patties and cheese.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in a McDouble?
faqs.a: Yes, around 34 g total carbs, mostly from the bun, with 2 g fiber.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in a McDouble?
faqs.a: Approximately 810 mg, mainly from condiments and cheese.

faqs.q: Does a McDouble have trans fat?
faqs.a: About 1 g of trans fat per burger; opt for modifications to reduce.
